text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Lately I’ve been playing the game Harvest
Moon: A Tale of Two Towns on my 3DS, I love it.

I love being in the little town of Blue Bell,
because I’m with all my little animals.

Anyways, I’m excited because I just unlocked
the recipe for Tiramisu!

I finally got my cacao plant, my coffee plant,
I got my cows, my
chickens and I was able to make Tiramisu!

Part of my family is Italian, we have many
tiramisu recipes and
I have never made one before on

Nerdy Nummies, so today I’m gonna share
one of my family recipes with you guys, this

one is the easiest because you make it with
pre-made ladyfingers.

So today, we’re gonna be making Harvest
Moon Tiramisu! Let’s get started!

The things you will need, will be: One package
of Lady Fingers, and for those of you

who don’t know, Ladyfingers are Italian
Biscuits, they’re sponge biscuits!

Four cups of Espresso Blend Coffee, six Eggs,
16 ounces of Mascarpone Cheese,

one cup of heavy whipping cream, six tablespoons
of sugar 1/4 cup of Marsala wine,

this is optional, you don’t need to add
this step if you'd like to make it
non-alcoholic. And 1/2 cup of cocoa powder.

You will also need three mixing bowls, I’ve
got one large and two medium a little
sifter, a mixer and a tray.
Now let’s put it all together!

The first thing that you’re gonna do is
take your medium sized bowl and you’re gonna
pour your heavy cream, bew!

Then we’re gonna whip it up on a medium
speed until it turns into whipped cream!
Once your cream is whipped, like this, oh!

We’re gonna set it off to the side and we’re
gonna go get 2 more bowls.

In your bowls, we are gonna crack our eggs,
we are gonna be placing the egg yolks

into our big bowl and the egg whites into
our medium bowl.

Now we’re gonna meringue our egg whites,
and how you do that is you’re gonna take your

beater and mix this mixture on a medium high
speed until it stiffens.
And boom! That is a meringue!

You really gotta mix it, I mixed it for about
5 minutes, for it to look like this.

Isn’t that neat! You start with egg whites
and end up with meringue!

Now, we’ve got our big bowl of egg yolks,
we are gonna pour in all of our sugar,

bewp! And we’re gonna mix it up for 3 minutes
to make a zabaglione.

Now that we’ve got our egg yolk and sugar mixed
up, we’re gonna add our cheese!
Yum, yum, yum, yum, yum!
Oh! I just want to eat it right now!!!
Oh no, no, no, no!
That was a close call!

Now you’re gonna take your mixture and we’re
gonna mix together until everything
is well combined.

All of our mixtures are ready, and now we’re
gonna fold them together.

We are gonna fold our white meringue into
our cheese yolk mixture.

A fold is where you scoop down, and then you
fold it up and around!

Last mixture that we’re gonna fold in is
our whipped cream that we made earlier.

So you’re just gonna take your spatula again
and fold ‘em in!

Now for my favorite part, we are gonna dip
our little ladyfingers.

So I put a bunch of little ladyfingers on
a plate over here, and here is the wine.

So this part is totally optional, so you don’t
need to do it, but I’m gonna

pour a little bit of wine into my coffee,
boop!

What you’re gonna do is you’re gonna take
a ladyfinger, dip into your coffee
mixture, and then place it into the pan.

And how you’re gonna place it will be like
this, two next to each other.

And you’re gonna go all the way down, covering
the whole bottom of the pan.

A quick tip that I have is like to dip them
horizontal, and you want to move

quickly because this is a sponge dessert,
it will absorb, and you don’t

want it to absorb too much liquid. So ready?
Here we go!
Dip, dip!
And put it right in the pan.

We’ve got our first layer of ladyfingers
in the pan, and now we are gonna add

1/2 of our cream mixture, on top, we’re
just gonna spread it on evenly,

and then we’re gonna add 1/2 of our cocoa
mixture, just sift it on a light layer.
Oh this is a little messy!

I make it rain, I make it rain, I make it
rain!

Now we are gonna repeat everything again.
We are gonna add our second layer of

ladyfingers, the second half of the cream
mixture, and,
sprinkle the second half of the cocoa on top.

Now that we’ve got our Tiramisu dessert
all assembled, we are gonna let it chill

in the refrigerator for about 4 hours, to
let it set.

Or if you would like to nom, nom, nom, nom,
nom on this sooner!

You can pop this in the freezer for about
1 hour.

Ta-da! Here is the Tiramisu that we made today,
inspired by the game that I’ve been
playing, Harvest Moon: The Tale of Two Towns!

I just got so excited when I unlocked this
new recipe, and, I had to make it for
you guys!

I hope that you enjoyed it, I’ll be posting
lots of pictures on Facebook, Tumblr,
Twitter and Instagram!

And if you guys make this dessert, please
take a picture and send it to me.

I love seeing your baking creations, it just makes
my day, I get a kick out of it!

And, if you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!
Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!

And now for the best part, I get to eat it!
Mmmmmmm!

This is one of my favorite desserts, I love
Tiramisu!
Mmm! Mmm-mmm-mmm-mmm-mmm!
